alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Northeast Johnson County; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 23 at 3:44PM MDT until March 26 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. The highest totals are likely in the mountains, as well as along the Cody Foothills, northern Johnson County, and in the Thermopolis area. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and northwest Wyoming. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Stay tuned for updates. For the latest forecast on the web, go to weather.gov/riverton.
